title: Maliceprime
author: Maliceprime
content: The binance team have done it again, they have recovered 80% of the lost fund from Curve Finance, the hacker thought no one was watching but he is wrong, every new crypto exchange needs to learn from binance exchange.https://coinmarketcap.com/alexandria/article/binance-recovers-more-than-80-of-funds-stolen-in-curve-finance-attack

comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: Quote from: Maliceprime on August 13, 2022, 09:33:27 AMThe binance team have done it again, they have recovered 80% of the lost fund from Curve Finance, the hacker thought no one was watching but he is wrong, every new crypto exchange needs to learn from binance exchange.https://coinmarketcap.com/alexandria/article/binance-recovers-more-than-80-of-funds-stolen-in-curve-finance-attackI guess centralize exchange does have a good side, if the hacker had liquidate this funds on a decentralized exchange perhaps it would not have been easy to recover the funds. I wonder what the hacker was thinking doing a direct sale on binance! i soon the authority will uncover the identity soon.

comments.body: Uhm, another Defi platform got hacked? I barely know because of this thread. Damage is around $570k so far. We are monitoring.https://nitter.net/cz_binance/status/1557117359168659463Quote from: https://twitter.com/cz_binance/status/1557117359168659463They use GoDaddy for DNS, which is insecure. No web3 projects should use that. Very susceptible to social engineering.Isn't there was also another cryptocurrency platform/project that got the same DNS hijacking by GoDaddy? We are working with LE to return the funds to the users. The hacker kept on sending the funds to Binance in different ways, thinking we can't catch it. ðŸ˜‚#SAFUAnd that is the one where it got mentioned in the article. It is fubar that the attacker keeps repeating the same mistake again and again, well it is surely a good thing, though.Quote from: Bitstar_coin on August 13, 2022, 09:54:05 AMsoon the authority will uncover the identity soon.It might not come easy, it is probable that the attacker is using stolen personal identifications.

I don't agree with your headline of this thread though as i think that Binance main motive or goal is not to help every crypto user and investor as good as possible. Their main goal is to make as much money as possible and so far they were extremely successful doing that.I always find it a little bit worrying when a company becomes to big and powerful within a certain industry. Just take coinmarketcap for example. It was an independent site to track crypto prices until like a year ago or so. Then binance bought it. Now of course it is a tool of Binance to promote their projects and so on.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: It's easy to track transactions on the Blockchain, but Binance did an achievement where they managed to track a transaction that I believe was scripted by the Thief. I'm sure the Binance Team did advanced tracking of this case, we should be proud to have Binance as the #1 trading platform, they are doing everything for the ecosystem in crypto as a whole.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: I mean that's just a common practice from a centralized exchanges and it's easy to trace the funds come from if they're not using any mixer, the news is too exaggerating like Binance is the one who save the hack and recover it with their technical knowledge. They're only need to trace the transaction with similar amount and trace the address, if it's came from the hacker, they can simply freeze the funds and ask the Curve Finance CEO to reverse the transaction.

comments.author: Jody.Drummer
comments.body: Quote from: Maliceprime on August 13, 2022, 09:33:27 AMThe binance team have done it again, they have recovered 80% of the lost fund from Curve Finance, the hacker thought no one was watching but he is wrong, every new crypto exchange needs to learn from binance exchange.https://coinmarketcap.com/alexandria/article/binance-recovers-more-than-80-of-funds-stolen-in-curve-finance-attackIf I'm not mistaken, I saw a tweet that marked CZ from the victim's statement who actually lost his funds in his Binance account when making a deposit with an address that automatically changed to the thief's address. Unfortunately I can no longer find the tweet.The conclusion is that every time we make a deposit or withdrawal, we need to pay attention to the address many times and as much as possible ensure the appropriate initial, middle and end digits. Usually I paste it first to compare whether it's the same or not at least 2 to 3 checks.
